geneVariantDescriptions.description: RB1 positive indicates the presence of the RB1 gene, mRNA, and/or protein.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ibrance (palbociclib) inhibited proliferation of RB1-proficient glioblastoma cell lines in culture and inhibited tumor growth in intracranial cell line xenograft models (PMID: 20354191).

references.title: Pharmacologic inhibition of cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 arrests the growth of glioblastoma multiforme intracranial xenografts.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ibrance (palbociclib) inhibited Rb1 phosphorylation in tumor tissues and improved survival in patient-derived intracranial xenograft models of medulloblastoma (PMID: 27012813).

references.title: DiSCoVERing Innovative Therapies for Rare Tumors: Combining Genetically Accurate Disease Models with In Silico Analysis to Identify Novel Therapeutic Targets.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I clinical trial, Kisqali (ribociclib) demonstrated safety and preliminary efficacy in patients with RB1-positive solid tumors and lymphomas, resulting in partial responses in 2.3% (3/132) of patients and stable disease in 32.6% (41/132) of patients, including 8 patients demonstrating stable disease for greater than 6 months (PMID: 27542767, PMID: 24795392).

references.title: Molecular pathways: CDK4 inhibitors for cancer therapy.
A phase I study of the single-agent CDK4/6 inhibitor LEE011 in pts with advanced solid tumors and lymphomas.
A Phase I Study of the Cyclin-Dependent Kinase 4/6 Inhibitor Ribociclib (LEE011) in Patients with Advanced Solid Tumors and Lymphomas.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase I trial, alternating sequential treatment with Ibrance (palbociclib) and Taxol (paclitaxel) resulted in a median progression-free survival (mPFS) of 209 days in patients with Rb1-positive breast cancer, with a mPFS of 802 days and a clinical benefit rate of 55.6% (5/9) at the recommended phase II dose (PMID: 30635336; NCT01320592).

references.title: Combination Paclitaxel and Palbociclib: Results of a Phase I Trial in Advanced Breast Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase II clinical trial, Ibrance (palbociclib) demonstrated efficacy and improved progression free survival in patients with CDK4 amplified liposarcoma with expression of RB1 (PMID: 23569312).

references.title: Phase II trial of the CDK4 inhibitor PD0332991 in patients with advanced CDK4-amplified well-differentiated or dedifferentiated liposarcoma.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase 0 trial, Kisqali (ribociclib) demonstrated good CNS penetration and inhibited Rb1 phoaphorylation and tumor cell proliferation, resulted in a median progression-free survival of 9.7 week and an overall survival of 7.8 months in patients (n=6) with recurrent glioblastoma with intact Rb1 expression and harboring deletion of CDKN2A or amplification of CDK4 or CDK6 (PMID: 31285369; NCT02933736).

references.title: A Phase 0 Trial of Ribociclib in Recurrent Glioblastoma Patients Incorporating a Tumor Pharmacodynamic- and Pharmacokinetic-Guided Expansion Cohort.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, G1T38 treatment resulted in growth inhibition in AR-negative, RB1-positive prostate cancer cell lines in culture (AACR, Cancer Res: April 2016; Volume 57, Abstract #2820).

references.title: Effects of a CDK 4/6 inhibitor, G1T38, in androgen receptor sensitive and resistant models of castrate resistant prostate cancer

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, Ibrance (palbociclib) inhibited tumor growth and improved survival in patient-derived intracranial xenografts models of RB-proficient glioblastoma harboring homozygous deletion of the CDKN2A and CDKN2B (PMID: 20354191).

molecularProfile.profileName: CDKN2A loss CDKN2B loss RB1 pos

references.title: Pharmacologic inhibition of cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 arrests the growth of glioblastoma multiforme intracranial xenografts.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Ibrance (palbociclib) resulted in growth inhibition of RB1-positive, estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer cells expressing ESR1-YAP1 in culture and inhibition of tumor growth in a RB1-positive, estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer patient-derived xenograft (PDX) model harboring ESR1-YAP1, which demonstrated reduced phosphorylation of Rb1 and decreased Ki67 levels (PMID: 30089255).

references.title: Functional Annotation of ESR1 Gene Fusions in Estrogen Receptor-Positive Breast Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a preclinical study, treatment with Ibrance (palbociclib) resulted in growth inhibition of RB1-positive, estrogen-receptor positive breast cancer cells expressing ESR1-PCDH11X in culture (PMID: 30089255).

references.title: Functional Annotation of ESR1 Gene Fusions in Estrogen Receptor-Positive Breast Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase 0 trial, Kisqali (ribociclib) demonstrated good CNS penetration and inhibited Rb1 phoaphorylation and tumor cell proliferation, resulted in a median progression-free survival of 9.7 week and an overall survival of 7.8 months in patients (n=6) with recurrent glioblastoma with intact Rb1 expression and harboring deletion of CDKN2A or amplification of CDK4 or CDK6 (PMID: 31285369; NCT02933736).

references.title: A Phase 0 Trial of Ribociclib in Recurrent Glioblastoma Patients Incorporating a Tumor Pharmacodynamic- and Pharmacokinetic-Guided Expansion Cohort.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase III trial (PALOMA-3), RB1 expression level did not correlate with response to addition of Ibrance (palbociclib) to Faslodex (fulvestrant) in patients with hormone receptor-positive, Erbb2 (Her2)-negative breast cancer, with hazard ratios for progression-free survival of Ibrance (palbociclib) versus placebo of 0.425 and 0.672 (p=0.123) in RB1 low and high expression groups, respectively (PMID: 30807234; NCT01942135).

references.title: Cyclin E1 Expression and Palbociclib Efficacy in Previously Treated Hormone Receptor-Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase III trial (PALOMA-3), RB1 expression level did not correlate with response to addition of Ibrance (palbociclib) to Faslodex (fulvestrant) in patients with hormone receptor-positive, Erbb2 (Her2)-negative breast cancer, with hazard ratios for progression-free survival of Ibrance (palbociclib) versus placebo of 0.425 and 0.672 (p=0.123) in RB1 low and high expression groups, respectively (PMID: 30807234; NCT01942135).

references.title: Cyclin E1 Expression and Palbociclib Efficacy in Previously Treated Hormone Receptor-Positive Metastatic Breast Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a Phase 0 trial, Kisqali (ribociclib) demonstrated good CNS penetration and inhibited Rb1 phoaphorylation and tumor cell proliferation, resulted in a median progression-free survival of 9.7 week and an overall survival of 7.8 months in patients (n=6) with recurrent glioblastoma with intact Rb1 expression and harboring deletion of CDKN2A or amplification of CDK4 or CDK6 (PMID: 31285369; NCT02933736).

references.title: A Phase 0 Trial of Ribociclib in Recurrent Glioblastoma Patients Incorporating a Tumor Pharmacodynamic- and Pharmacokinetic-Guided Expansion Cohort.
